alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 10:15PM EDT until March 31 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT FOR FOUNTAIN...NORTHERN PARKE...EASTERN WARREN AND CENTRAL VERMILLION COUNTIES... At 1014 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Oxford to 6 miles south of Veedersburg, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of Fountain, northern Parke, eastern Warren and central Vermillion Counties. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 6 and 23. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for west central Indiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
